1.q_string: The ionization enthalpy of hydrogen atom is \(1.312 \times 10^{6} J mol ^{-1}\). The energy required to excite the electron in the atom from \(n=1\) to \(n=2\) is:
Which of the following statements in relation to the hydrogen atom is correct?
q_option: 3s orbital is lower in energy than 3p orbital.
3p orbital is lower in energy than 3d orbital.
3s and 3p orbitals are of lower energy than 3d orbital.
3s, 3p and 3d orbitals all have the same energy.

1.q_string:
For combustion of 1 mole of benzene at \(25^{\circ} C\), the heat of reaction at constant pressure is \(-780.9 {~kcal}\). What will be the heat of reaction at constant volume?

 \(C_{6} H_{6(l)}+7 \frac{1}{2} {O}_{2(g)} \rightarrow 6 {CO}_{2(g)}+3 {H}_{2} {O}_{(l)}\)

Reaction of methanol with dioxygen was carried out and \(\Delta U\) was found to be-

\(726 {~kJ} {~mol}^{-1}\) at \(298 {~K}\). The enthalpy change for the reaction will be: 

\({CH}_{3} {OH}_{(l)}+\frac{3}{2} {O}_{2({g})} \rightarrow {CO}_{2({g})}+2 {H}_{2} {O}_{(l)} \Delta H=-726 {~KJ~mol}^{(-1)}\)

The molar heat capacity of water at constant pressure, \(C_{{p}}\) is \(75 {~J} {~K}^{-1}\) mol \(^{-1}\). When \(10 {~KJ}\) of heat is supplied to \(1 {~kg}\) water which is free to expand, the increase in temperature of water is:
What Does Determine the Chemical Behaviour of Atoms?
The correct order of penetrating power of \(3 \mathrm{~s}, 3 \mathrm{p}, 3 \mathrm{~d}\) electrons is:
Which of the following solution in water will have the lowest vapour pressure?
The states of matter having no definite shape but definite volume:
Amorphous form of Silica is:
Graphite is a soft solid lubricant extremely diffcult to melt. The reason for this anomalous behaviour is that graphite.
q_option: Has carbon atoms arranged in large plates of rings of strongly bound carbon atoms with weak interplate bonds
Has molecules of variable molecular masses like polymers.

1.q_string: Aqueous solution of which of the following compounds is electrolysed, when acetylene gas is obtained?

Direction: In each of the following questions a statement of assertion is given and a corresponding statement of reason is given just below it. Mark the correct statement as.

Assertion: Benzene reacts with iodine monochloride in presence of anhyd.AlCl3 to form iodobenzene.

Reason: Iodine monochloride reacts with anhyd. AlCl3 to produce I+ which attacks the benzene ring.
q_option: Both Assertion and Reason are correct and Reason is the correct explanation for Assertion
Both Assertion and Reason are correct but Reason is not the correct explanation for Assertion
Assertion is correct but Reason is incorrect

q_option: Portland cement is the most commonly used cement for construction work.
Portland cement is made from raw material which consist of \(60 \%\) lime (calcium oxide), \(25 \%\) silica (silicon dioxide), \(5 \%\) alumina. The rest is iron oxide and gypsum (calcium sulphate).
Portland cement gets its name from the stone quarried from the Isle of Portland in England which has a similar texture.

1.q_string: \(Ca \left( H _{2} P O _{4}\right)_{2}\) in baking powder:
q_option: Behaves as an acid in moist conditions and decomposes \(NaHCO _{3}\) to give \(CO _{2}\)
Behave as a base in moist condition and gives \(H _{3} PO _{4}\)

q_option: Ozone hole is a hole formed in stratosphere from which ozone oozes out.
Ozone hole is a hole formed in troposphere from which ozone oozes out.
Ozone hole is thinning of ozone layer of stratosphere at some places.
Ozone hole means vanishing of ozone layer around the earth completely.
